headline: Mrs. Sigg's Snickerdoodles
description: This snickerdoodle recipe is a real crowd-pleaser. Who doesn't love snickerdoodle cookies with crisp edges, chewy centers, and a spiced sugar coating?

video.description: Simple ingredients and full of cinnamon and sugar – these cookies are a delight!
video.name: Mrs. Sigg's Snickerdoodles

name: Mrs. Sigg's Snickerdoodles

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Make cookies: Beat sugar, butter, shortening, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth and creamy.

Whisk flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl. Gradually mix dry ingredients mixture into the wet ingredients just until combined. Shape dough into walnut-sized balls.
Make cinnamon-sugar: Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl or zip-top plastic bag.
Place dough balls in cinnamon-sugar and roll or shake until coated. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until set but not too hard, 8 to 10 minutes, switching racks halfway through.
Remove from the oven and immediately transfer to wire racks to cool.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! Beautiful crunch on the edges and a soft gooy delicate center. 11/10!!

These cookies were very easy to make, and tasted delicious. I baked the two trays, simultaneously, on different racks of the oven. I thought this was a problem; however, my family was very happy because one pan was a bit toasted and crispy and the other, chewy and a tiny bit gooey. Win-win. (Next time, I'll bake them separately, on the middle oven rack.)
Easy delicious recipe. I made exactly as recipe is. Everyone loved them. Will make these again!
The recipe was great, but I checked on them after 7 minutes and they were already too brown. A couple edges were black. Next batch will be baked at 350° for 6 minutes and checked.

These are very good, but it is unclear whether the recipe calls for UNSALTED or SALTED butter, so since 1/4 teaspoon salt is in the recipe, I decided to go with unsalted butter. I read a lot of people saying the taste of these cookies seem “muted,” and I definitely think the missing piece is a little more salt…whether that means increasing the salt in the recipe or using salted butter instead of unsalted. Still, these are pretty tasty and hold their shape well!

Baked them for 8 mins (turned the baking sheet at the 4th minute) and left them on the sheet to cool a bit before transferring them to the rack. I didn't change the recipe, but i noticed that the coating on my cookies were a bit darker - probably because i double coated them in the cinnamon sugar mixture to make sure it really tasted of cinnamon. I used a small ice cream scoop to make evenly sized smaller cookies. Good solid recipe, will make again.
Recipe was perfect Cooked for 10 min - large cookies - 12 per sheet Coked for 8 min - smaller cookies - 20 per sheet nice and soft and chewy

This is a great recipe. I doubted the recipe and added a couple tsps of cinnamon to the dough like others suggested. Made the first batch too big and over baked them so cut them down to walnut size and baked them for 9 mins. Perfect!
Everyone loved them and asked for more

9 minutes is a perfect amount of time for my oven. I added cinnamon to the dough and sprinkled some after as they were cooling To get a stronger cinnamon flavor. I also like adding white morsels to the dough

This is a good recipe! They are super soft with that nice snickerdoodle tang. A few notes: replace 1/4 of your sugar with cinnamon sugar for a stronger cinnamon taste. I also recommend refrigerating the dough. It was easier to handle. If you are getting flat cookies...it's all about bake time. I saw someone said eight minutes, my magic number was 11 minutes. Unfortunately not all ovens cook the same, so play with your baking time. When I took them out at 8, they deflated. They taste amazing!
Thank you for an excellent recipe. I sprinkled them with leftover sugar and cinnamon mixture right out of the oven-- yummy.
loved them

Like many others said, the flavor was really mild, like a muted snickerdoodle, or like a sugar cookie with a cinnamon coating. Perhaps cinnamon needs to be added to the dough. Will be playing with it to get that full snickerdoodle flavor. But texture and bake came out perfect.
So delicious! This will be my go to recipe anytime I make snickerdoodles!
Best snickerdoodle recipe! I sprinkle with touch of red sugar crystals after baking for Christmas 🎄

These are flavorful cookies and snickerdoodles are always a holiday favorite. I doubled the recipe, and for the cinnamon-sugar coating I used 3/4 cup sugar + 1/4 cup cinnamon (multiplying each listed amount above by 6) so I had enough sugar-cinnamon mixture to easily use in a plastic bag and roll the cookie dough in. I agree with Chef Joy that you can't overcoat the cookie dough balls. I used a #30 scoop (1.25 oz) which is the size of a walnut and was surprised it yielded 48 cookies. Either the suggested yield listed above should be changed to 24 cookies, or the size of each cookie should be 1/2 a walnut. I added vanilla bean powder and a touch of nutmeg (something I often do during the holidays to add punch to the flavor without altering the consistency of the dough). Thank you, Beth Sigworth, for sharing this great recipe.
These came out perfect! Soft, chewy, and not too sweet. Followed the recipe exactly and 8 mins in the oven was just right. Fast and easy and so good!
The best cookies I've ever made - according to my family and myself!
These are SO good. Followed the recipe as written and it's delicious. Try them warm from the oven with ice cream!
Absolutely the best Snickerdoodle, you won't eat just one!

Friends and family are in LOVE! Super soft and airy :) personally I like them to have more cinnamon because it adds more flavor, so I recommend making you cinnamon sugar a little more on the brown side!
My kids love these cookies have been baking them for years...
They are the best cookie ever !!!!
The kids adored them. Im on the fence.

They turned out looking just like the pictures so I'm reasonably sure I nailed it! I'm just a bit disappointed. They don't have a lot of flavour and I can definitely taste the shortening. Not my cup of tea, but if you're looking for a mild cookie then look no further! They have a great texture and come together quickly

These turned out perfectly. I literally scream with joy when I bit into them at the end of it all! This is an amazing recipe and I will be using again in the future! Cannot wait to have the party guests try them!
these cookies are a big hit in my family. fluffy and so yummy!!!
Easy to do!
Not sure what went wrong. Didn’t expand much and didn’t cook thru in 8-10mins Tasted ok though.
I bake at 10 min in my oven, but then again I super-sized them. These are the best ever snickerdoodles! Our church camp loved them!
I made no changes. This recipe is good. I highly recommend it.
Me and my whole family absolutely adored this recipe. This is my new go to for snickerdoodles!!
I used all butter no shortening. Also used all purpose gluten free flour
Easy to make, taste great, will make again.
They were so yummy! Recommended for young chefs. We used butter instead of shortening, and they turned out great!!
haven't tasted them yet but these cookies came out of the oven flat as pancakes! Won't be making them again.
It was very tasty and cooking it for 8 minutes exact led to the perfect crunch outside and a soft inside.

I hate it when people rate a recipe which they have made with numerous changes. So my rating is for this being a great starting point for my first time making snickerdoodles. I used a ~1-5/8" dia. Farberware Cookie scoop that I use for all my Tollhouse cookies and the yield was 38 cookies that are about 2-1/4" dia. (This was ~16 less cookies for the same time spent vs. making Tollhouse cookies.) I love cinnamon so I threw an extra 1/2t in with the dry ingredients. I also added 1T of wheat gluten to see if it would make these chewy. I'm not sure either of these additions had any impact. I don't stock "regular" shortening (Crisco?) so I used coconut oil which I also stopped using several years ago but my wife bought a jar for some reason so I thought I'd use it before it expires. Due to the size, I had to increase the baking time to 12-13 minutes, it is difficult to tell when these are done. I over softened (i.e. I melted the butter) so after blending with the coconut oil, I put it in the fridge while I gathered and mixed the dry ingredients. I also refrigerated the dough for a few minutes while the oven pre heated and I cut parchment paper for my cookie sheets. The resultant cookies stayed lofty, not flat with a chewy center and crunchy edge as some recipes state. My wife's opinion is that they are perfect.
Excellent as is, and also excellent as a blank cookie canvas for rolling in almost anything you'd like! I've rolled the dough in sprinkles, cocoa powder, and coconut with excellent results.

Love this recipe and have made it several times. My family craves the sweet cinnamon aroma each time I make them! I was halfway I to the recipe tonight however and discovered I had no cream of tartar. I discovered another snicker doodle recipe in my online search for a suitable replacement. The recipe had the same amount of baking soda to tartar and noted that In a pinch just use 2 tsp baking powder and drop both the soda and the tartar. I did know baking powder contained both but wasn't sure of how much to use. The two teaspoons full worked beautifully, as you can see! I used the medium Pampered Chef cookie scoop and got 33 cookies out of it..well, maybe 34..hubs was sitting nearby and I did turn my back a time or two! Lol
It could use a little more flavor but that could be cause my cinnamon was expired lol
I love the chewy inside and crispy edges. Very yummy 😋 😍 I added this recipe to my little book. Thank you 😊
This recipe is one of my standards. The cookies are so delicious. Don’t bake them too long and if you like cinnamon as much as I do, which is a lot, make extra sugar/cinnamon.
Best cookie ever!

The very best snickerdoodle recipe I've ever tried! For those having trouble, some things to try: 1. Make sure you are using real ingredients (e.g., no margarine substitutes for butter) that are relatively fresh (yes, flour loses effectiveness before it goes bad, and spices don't last that long). 2. Butter flavored shortening enhances the taste a little. 3. Follow standard cookie protocol: cream the butter, shortening, sugars, and eggs for at least 5 minutes before adding the dry ingredients. 4. Add fresh grated nutmeg (about 1/8 to 1/4 tsp) to the cinnamon sugar mixture. 5. Use extra fine sugar in the cinnamon sugar mixture. It pretty much melts into the cookie that way! 6. Make SURE you remove it from the pan almost immediately. Snickerdoodles rely on a delicate balance between lightly crisp exterior and a tender interior, hence the high cooking temp. But if you leave it on the hot pan, it will continue to cook and be tougher. Hope this helps!
Perfect!!!!! 💖
Very delicious! My picky sister loves them. I’ve mailed them from North Carolina to California many times and my sister stated they are the best Snickerdoodle's ever!
They were great but probably Doesn’t need cream of tartar..

If I could give this recipe 6 stars I would! I have probably made it at least ten times. It is my go-to cookie recipe and has never failed me once. Everyone who has ever tried them has raved about them. The only thing I change is I use almond extract instead of vanilla which I think gives them a nice flavor, however, they are still phenomenal using vanilla.
Absolutely the best Snickerdoodles I have ever made!! Definitely will be a repeat in our house!

have made these cookies many times. Only thing I do different is add cinnamon to the cookie dough. I would say 99% of the time they turn out, once in a blue moon the allotted cooking time is too long and they go a bit brown. But mostly they turn out great and soft.
My boyfriend rated these in his top 7 snickerdoodles he's ever had. Not bad.
Excellent! Everything a snickerdoodle should be, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. However, I also needed more sugar/cinnamon mixture. 8 minutes to cookie perfection!
Excellent recipe! Followed recipe as written.

Tasty. Made them twice in a row because they didn't last long with the fam. My daughter didn't want the cinnamon so I rolled a few with just sugar and they were great too. Will definitely make again soon My only thing is that I changed the sugar/cinnamon ratio next time to have more sugar than cinnamon because I like my snickerdoodles to have that sugary feeling around them

Cookies were great! However, instructions need to be updated for those who aren’t avid bakers. On step 3, I used 2 tablespoons of sugar and 2 tablespoons of cinnamon because I did not know better. Without scrolling back up to the ingredients it makes it sound like I am adding 2 Tbsp’s of sugar and 2 Tbsp’s of cinnamon. The instructions should say “Mix cinnamon and 2 tablespoons of sugar together.”

I've never made snickerdoodles before. After making these, I have absolutely no idea why! I made the recipe as written and they were fantastic. So good that I'm making more again tomorrow as these were gone in a flash!
Followed the recipe exactly and they turned out amazing. There isn't a single thing I would change. They are delicious!

Yum!
The cookies were tasty even though I left baking soda out accidentally.
I like the recipe. It is fun and easy.
Cookies became too thin and burned.
Delicious!
They came out perfect..... This is the cookie that Santa will enjoy.
These are perfect! Will definitely keep this recipe!
Good. Not as flavorful as I expected
So so good! I used 2 tbsp per cookie & baked 13 mins to make them a little bigger. They were wonderful!!
Very good!Thanks!
These are excellent! Made them exactly as the recipe states and wouldn't change a thing! Will begin to make every Christmas!
These are my favorite snickerdoodles, by far! Made these with Pampered Chef's Cinnamon Plus which elevated the taste!!
No changes, delicious

With the exception of using butter-flavored shortening instead of 1/2 shortening and 1/2 butter I make this recipe as it is. These cookies are a big hit and disappear as soon as I put them out at work! They are a favorite at home as well.
Came out perfect. 8 minutes at 400. Followed recipe exactly. Thanks
I made the recipe exactly as is and they were perfect. My husband said they’re his new favorite cookie! This works for me because they’re significantly easier to make than my usual fall treats
Very easy to make and very tasty. I don’t think they will last long. ??
This recipe is amazing! The cookies turned out beautiful and my coworkers loved them! Will definitely make them again!

Haven't baked them yet so we'll see how this goes. I made some adjustments. 
1C sugar 3T maple syrup 
added a dash of ginger
Added about 2 t evaporated milk 
Subtracted 1/2 T fat
These are so good my family is not a huge fan of snickerdoodle cookies and they loved them. I definitely recommend making these and saving this recipe.

Just pulled the first batch out of the oven and tried one. OMG, these are fantastic!!! Believe it or not, I’ve never had a snickerdoodle but they are a favorite of my husband’s growing up. I decided to make them for a neighbor whose kids don’t care for chocolate. Found this easy recipe. So glad I did!! Made them as written but only had vanilla bean paste. Don’t know if that changed the recipe but they’re SO GOOD!!! Crisp on the outside and soft, chewy on the inside. Vanilla-y and perfect for fall. Will be making again and again!! Thanks for the recipe

I made a double recipe. Followed instructions. Rolled flat 1 tablespoon of dough (not heaping), rolled in cinnamon sugar, kept round on baking sheet. Baked 8 minutes. They did not flatten too much. Could have baked 7 minutes. My oven may run a little hot at 400 degrees. Flavor - a little bland, maybe use a little more salt. I understand what some have said about the after taste from cream of tarter. Crisp on outside and soft in the middle. Overall fairly good cookie.

9 minutes was the key for me. 10 minutes got me a slightly singed bottom and cakey texture. Adding a little bit of chipotle pepper powder to the dough as well as to the sugar cinnamon coating mix was a huge hit! You won't regret it.

Super easy and delicious! For my oven, the time took a little longer than the 8-10 minutes as suggested, more like 10-12 minutes. I kept checking on them though and wanted to be sure they weren't undercooked. They ship perfectly and my college daughter loved them!
Easy to make and very good! First snickerdoodle I’ve made. Crunchy outside and soft inside.
The recipe worked out perfect! I replaced the cream of tartar with same amount of lemon juice, and no issues.
Seriously the best snickerdoodle cookie recipe I’ve found! Follow the recipe exactly and get perfect results!
Great recipe. The only one I use for snickerdoodles
Delicious recipe! I made them a little bigger at 10 minutes and they came out perfect for my taste.
Why so much cream of tarter? It gives them an overpowering acidic taste. IF I ever made them again, I’d halve the amount of CoT.
This was good but I personally wasn’t a fan of the cream of tartar taste so I’m going to try this again with less, but overall it was fantastic!
Delicious! Came out perfect! Followed it almost exactly except I didn't have any shortening. So I substituted for butter and margarine. Worked great!

I've made this recipe at least a dozen times, everyone loves them. I ended up changing up 2 things. I adjusted the cook temp to 365° instead of 400° because I kept getting flat and crunchy cookies; the cook time is the same. Make sure you remove them from the cookie sheet immediately after taking them out of the oven. I also adjusted the coating to be 3TBS white sugar and 3tsp cinnamon for a better flavor

So before cooking I dumped my cookies in the cinnamon and sugar mixture and then I put them in the oven but they came out Burt so then I just mixed in the cinnamon and sugar into the cookie dough best thing i have done .
turned out awesome. made with bobs red mill cup to cup flour to make it gluten free and loved!
If using convection oven and Tablespoons of dough, bake at 375 for 8 1/2 minutes.
I made the cookies but they turned out a little crispy and not as gooey. Also they just tasted like sugar cookies with cinnamon. Not as good as expected.

Absolutely the flattest snickerdoodle cookie I’ve ever made, or seen. Didn’t even taste like a snickerdoodle cookie except for the hint of cinnamon. I couldn’t find my usual recipe so I thought I’d try this because it showed Crisco in it and I know the recipe I’ve used before used Crisco. Not saving this one then when I print it off will go in the trash. Very disappointed
Easy recipe, just follow the directions and they will be perfect. I used PENZEY’S cinnamon sugar to roll them in & they were nice and cinnamony!
Tried these once so far, and had my Mother ask for the recipe to replace hers.
its ok
